org.nodes

Interface TGraph<L,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    L - The label type
    T - The tag type
    All Superinterfaces:
    Graph<L>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DTGraph<L,T>, UTGraph<L,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LightDTGraph, MapDTGraph, MapUTGraph

    public interface TGraph<L,T>
extends Graph<L>
    A graph with both nodes and links labeled. The labels of graph links are called tags. TGraph is short for Tagged Graph
    Author:
    Peter

      long state()
      The state of a graph indicates whether it has changed.

        java.util.Collection<? extends TLink<L,T>> links()
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Returns a collection of links currently in the graph. Note that modifying the graph while iterating over its links can cause undefined behavior.

      • connected

        boolean connected(L from,
                L to)
        Checks whether two nodes exist with the given labels that are connected. If multiple pairs of nodes exist with these labels, only one of them needs to be connected for the method to return true.
        Specified by:
        connected in interface Graph<L>
        Parameters:
        first -
        second -
        Returns:

      • state

        long state()
        The state of a graph indicates whether it has changed. If the value returned by this method has changed, then a modification has been made. If the value is the same, then with great likelihood, the graph has not been modified.
        Specified by:
        state in interface Graph<L>
        Returns:
